abstracts.cdata!:
The Second Structural Adjustment Loan
            Project aims at achieving sustained and efficient economic
            growth while reducing inflation and improving external
            creditworthiness. The loan supports reforms that will
            correct relative price distortions, increase competition,
            improve mobility of resources and promote efficiency in an
            environment based on a competitive market. Measures
            implemented include: (a) setting real interest rates at
            positive levels; (b) establishing a market for foreign
            exchange; and (c) liberalizing the foreign trade and
            domestic pricing regimes. Other reforms, embarked upon, but
            requiring a longer implementation period include: (a)
            tightening financial discipline in the enterprise and
            banking sectors; (b) improving the process of selection of
            investment projects; (c) supporting the expansion of private
            sector and small- and medium-scale enterprises and
            rehabilitation of viable enterprises facing financial
            difficulties while weeding out chronic loss makers; (d)
            strengthening the central banking function of the National
            Bank of Yugoslavia (NBY) while establishing banks as
            independent, shareholding entities; and (e) mitigating the
            social and productive disruptions which can accompany
            structural adjustment of the economy.
